header.title: snmpa_discovery_handler

erlref.modulesummary: Behavior module for the SNMP agent discovery handler.

description.p: This module defines the behavior of the agent discovery handler.
The function in this module must be exported from an snmpa_discovery_handler-compliant module.

desc.p:
This function is called at the end of stage 1 of the discovery process. It is to return the atom ignore or {ok, usm_entry() | [usm_entry()]}. For more information, see section
Security Data for USM in the User's Manual and
snmpa_conf:usm_entry/13.
If the function returns ignore, it is assumed that one of the following applies:

list.item: The caller (of the discovery function) will make the needed updates later.
The callback function itself did the updates.

desc.p:
In either case, the agent does nothing, but returns the retrieved ManagerEngineID (for more information, see
snmpa:discovery) and possible continue with stage 2 of the discovery process.

Argument ExtraInfo is passed on from the
snmpa:discovery function.
This function can return an updated NewExtraInfo that is used in the following calls to the callback functions. Intended for future use.
The purpose of this function is to generate the USM- related security data needed for USM processing in the agent. Specifically, updating the usmUserTable.
When an usm_entry() tuple (or a list of such tuples) is returned, this data is added to the usmUserTable by the (master-)agent.
When a usm_entry() tuple (or a list of such tuples) is returned, this data is added to the usmUserTable by the (master-)agent.

note.p: This function does not check if this entry already exists.
This function is executed in the context of the master-agent process.
